UniProt Entry.description: The amino acid sequence of the current peptide coincides with the part of the UniProt entry that represents a peptide precursor.

Literature.Title: Replacement of l-Amino Acids by d-Amino Acids in the Antimicrobial Peptide Ranalexin and Its Consequences for Antimicrobial Activity and Biodistribution.
Literature.Author: Domhan C, Uhl P, Kleist C, Zimmermann S, Umstatter F, Leotta K, Mier W, Wink M

Sequence Information.Target Organism: Bacillus megaterium DSM 32(MIC=4µg/ml),Bacillus subtilis DSM 10(MIC=4µg/ml),Clostridium pasteurianum DSM 525(MIC=8µg/ml),Corynebacterium spheniscorum DSM 44757(MIC=8µg/ml),Enterococcus casseliflavus ATCC 700327(MIC=8µg/ml),Enterococcus faecalis ATCC 29212(MIC=16µg/ml),Enterococcus faecium(MIC=8µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 25923(MIC=4µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus NCTC 10442(MIC=8µg/ml),Staphylococcus epidermidis ATCC 14990(MIC=16µg/ml),Staphylococcus saprophyticus ATCC 15305(MIC=16µg/ml),Acinetobacter baumannii(MIC=4-16µg/ml),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=32µg/ml),Escherichia coli O157:H7 ATCC 35150(MIC=32µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MIC=>64µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae(MIC=>64µg/ml),Pseudomonas aeruginosa ATCC 27853(MIC=64µg/ml),Pseudomonas fluorescens DSM 50090(MIC=>64µg/ml),Yersinia mollaretii DSM 18520(MIC=>64µg/ml)
